triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: The paper addresses rumor detection specifically in social media contexts where rumors spread rapidly.

triples.name: Rumor spread in social network
triples.relevance: Understanding how rumors propagate in networks is the core problem the paper aims to solve.

triples.name: Graph neural network
triples.relevance: Graph neural networks form the foundation of the proposed Bi-GCN method for processing social network structures.

triples.name: Convolutional neural network
triples.relevance: Convolutional operations are the basis for GCN layers used to process graph-structured rumor propagation data.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: The paper applies deep learning methods to automatically learn rumor detection patterns from data.

triples.name: Recursive neural network
triples.relevance: RvNN is cited as a prior approach that the paper's method improves upon by capturing both propagation and dispersion patterns.

triples.name: Bi-Directional Graph Convolutional Networks
triples.relevance: The Bi-GCN is the novel method proposed to detect rumors by modeling both top-down and bottom-up information flow in social networks.
